availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. Brann (Pendleton County, KY, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Martha Callen Brann in Falmouth, Kentucky, on October 25, 1841. Father of Jonathan Brann, Mary Brann, Margaret Brann, James J. Brann, and Martha Brann. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Employed Joseph Brann as a farm laborer in Pendleton County in 1850. Justice of the peace in Pendleton County c1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 2, p. 323B.
